artist: Itō Shinsui; Published by Watanabe Shōzaburō; Printed by Ono Gintarō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait (bijin-ga); woman standing under partially unfolded light brown and tan umbrella in falling snow; woman wears purple, red and white checked wrap with maroon collar
marks: 昭和七年十二月 {Shōwa shichinen jūnigatsu} (December 1932 深水畫 {Shinsui ga} (picture by Shinsui)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text:
At 25 yen this was one of the most expensive prints in the publisher’s sales catalogue of 1935, probably because of high production costs. Extra time and labor would have been required to create the snow. 

In 1983 the Japanese government issued this print as a stamp, as part of its Modern Art series.
title: Snowstorm
